viber.Bot¶

class viber.Bot(token, name=None, avatar=None, base_url=None, request=None)¶

Bases: viber.base.ViberObject

This object represents a Telegram Bot.

Parameters:
  • token (str) – Bot’s unique authentication.
  • name (str, optional) – Bot’s name.
  • avatar (str, optional) – Bot’s avatar url.
  • base_url (str, optional) – Viber Bot API service URL.
background¶

URL for background for this bot.

Type:str
bot_name¶

Name for this bot.

Type:str
category¶

Category for this bot.

Type:str
chat_hostname¶

Chat hostname for this bot.

Type:int
country¶

Country code for this bot.

Type:str
delete_webhook(timeout=None, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to remove webhook integration. Requires no parameters.

Parameters:
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

bool On success, True is returned.
Raises:

viber.ViberError
event_types¶

Event types for this bot.

Type:list of viber.enums.EventType
get_account_info(timeout=None)¶

A simple method for testing your bot’s auth token. Requires no parameters.

Parameters:timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
Returns:A dict of parameters representing that bot if the credentials are valid, None otherwise.
Return type:dict
Raises:viber.ViberError

request¶
send_carousel(*args, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to send url messages.

Message and Keyboard can contain placeholders if list of user_ids used. | replace_me_with_receiver_id - will be replaced by the receiver ID | replace_me_with_url_encoded_receiver_id - will be replaced by the URL encoded receiver ID | replace_me_with_user_name - will be replaced by the receiver user name

Note

Carousel Content Message is supported on devices running Viber version 6.7 and above.

Parameters:
  • user_id (str) – Unique identifier for the target user.
  • rich_media (Keyboard) – Keyboard with type rich_media.
  • min_api_version (int, optional) – Minimal api version.
  • tracking_data (str, optional) – Allow the account to track messages and user’s replies. Sent tracking_data value will be passed back with user’s reply. Max 4000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_TRACKING_DATA_LENGTH.
  • keyboard (Keyboard, optional) – Keyboard to be sent.
  • min_api_version – Minimal api version.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

On success, the sent message is returned.
Return type:

viber.Message
Raises:

viber.ViberError
send_contact(*args, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to send contact messages.

Message and Keyboard can contain placeholders if list of user_ids used. | replace_me_with_receiver_id - will be replaced by the receiver ID | replace_me_with_url_encoded_receiver_id - will be replaced by the URL encoded receiver ID | replace_me_with_user_name - will be replaced by the receiver user name

Parameters:
  • user_id (str) – Unique identifier for the target user.
  • contact (Contact) – Contact to be sent.
  • name (str) – Name of the contact if contact is None
  • phone_number (str) – phone number of the contact if contact is None
  • tracking_data (str, optional) – Allow the account to track messages and user’s replies. Sent tracking_data value will be passed back with user’s reply. Max 4000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_TRACKING_DATA_LENGTH.
  • keyboard (Keyboard, optional) – Keyboard to be sent.
  • min_api_version (int, optional) – Minimal api version.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

On success, the sent message is returned.
Return type:

viber.Message
Raises:

viber.ViberError
send_file(*args, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to send file messages.

Message and Keyboard can contain placeholders if list of user_ids used. | replace_me_with_receiver_id - will be replaced by the receiver ID | replace_me_with_url_encoded_receiver_id - will be replaced by the URL encoded receiver ID | replace_me_with_user_name - will be replaced by the receiver user name

Parameters:
  • user_id (str) – Unique identifier for the target user.
  • media (str) – Url of the video(MP4, H264), max size is 50MB. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_FILE_SIZE.
  • size (int) – Size of the video in bytes.
  • file_name (str) – File name should include extension. Sending a file without extension or with the wrong extension might cause the client to be unable to open the file. Max 256 characters (including file extension) Also found as viber.constants.MAX_FILE_NAME_LENGTH.
  • tracking_data (str, optional) – Allow the account to track messages and user’s replies. Sent tracking_data value will be passed back with user’s reply. Max 4000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_TRACKING_DATA_LENGTH.
  • keyboard (Keyboard, optional) – Keyboard to be sent.
  • min_api_version (int, optional) – Minimal api version.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

On success, the sent message is returned.
Return type:

viber.Message
Raises:

viber.ViberError
send_location(*args, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to send location messages.

Message and Keyboard can contain placeholders if list of user_ids used. | replace_me_with_receiver_id - will be replaced by the receiver ID | replace_me_with_url_encoded_receiver_id - will be replaced by the URL encoded receiver ID | replace_me_with_user_name - will be replaced by the receiver user name

Parameters:
  • user_id (str) – Unique identifier for the target user.
  • location (Location) – Location to be sent.
  • lat (str) – Latitude of the location if location is None
  • lon (str) – Longitude of the location if location is None
  • tracking_data (str, optional) – Allow the account to track messages and user’s replies. Sent tracking_data value will be passed back with user’s reply. Max 4000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_TRACKING_DATA_LENGTH.
  • keyboard (Keyboard, optional) – Keyboard to be sent.
  • min_api_version (int, optional) – Minimal api version.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

On success, the sent message is returned.
Return type:

viber.Message
Raises:

viber.ViberError
send_message(*args, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to send text messages. Message and Keyboard can contain placeholders if list of user_ids used. | replace_me_with_receiver_id - will be replaced by the receiver ID | replace_me_with_url_encoded_receiver_id - will be replaced by the URL encoded receiver ID | replace_me_with_user_name - will be replaced by the receiver user name

Parameters:
  • user_id (str, List[str]) – Unique identifier for the target user.
  • text (str, optional) – Text of the messsage.
  • tracking_data (str, optional) – Allow the account to track messages and user’s replies. Sent tracking_data value will be passed back with user’s reply. Max 4000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_TRACKING_DATA_LENGTH.
  • keyboard (Keyboard, optional) – Keyboard to be sent.
  • min_api_version (int, optional) – Minimal api version.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

On success, the sent message is returned.
Return type:

viber.Message
Raises:

viber.ViberError
send_picture(*args, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to send picture messages.

Message and Keyboard can contain placeholders if list of user_ids used. | replace_me_with_receiver_id - will be replaced by the receiver ID | replace_me_with_url_encoded_receiver_id - will be replaced by the URL encoded receiver ID | replace_me_with_user_name - will be replaced by the receiver user name

Parameters:
  • user_id (str) – Unique identifier for the target user.
  • media (str) – Url of the JPEG image, max size is 1MB. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_PICTURE_SIZE.
  • description (str, optional) – Description of the picture to be sent. Max 120 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_PICTURE_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH.
  • thumbnail (str, optional) – Url of the thumbnail JPEG image, max size is 100KB. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_THUMBNAIL_SIZE.
  • tracking_data (str, optional) – Allow the account to track messages and user’s replies. Sent tracking_data value will be passed back with user’s reply. Max 4000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_TRACKING_DATA_LENGTH.
  • keyboard (Keyboard, optional) – Keyboard to be sent.
  • min_api_version (int, optional) – Minimal api version.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

On success, the sent message is returned.
Return type:

viber.Message
Raises:

viber.ViberError
send_sticker(*args, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to send sticker messages.

Message and Keyboard can contain placeholders if list of user_ids used. | replace_me_with_receiver_id - will be replaced by the receiver ID | replace_me_with_url_encoded_receiver_id - will be replaced by the URL encoded receiver ID | replace_me_with_user_name - will be replaced by the receiver user name

Parameters:
  • user_id (str) – Unique identifier for the target user.
  • sticker_id (int) – Unique Viber sticker ID. For examples visit https://viber.github.io/docs/tools/sticker-ids/ page.
  • tracking_data (str, optional) – Allow the account to track messages and user’s replies. Sent tracking_data value will be passed back with user’s reply. Max 4000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_TRACKING_DATA_LENGTH.
  • keyboard (Keyboard, optional) – Keyboard to be sent.
  • min_api_version (int, optional) – Minimal api version.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

On success, the sent message is returned.
Return type:

viber.Message
Raises:

viber.ViberError
send_url(*args, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to send url messages.

Message and Keyboard can contain placeholders if list of user_ids used. | replace_me_with_receiver_id - will be replaced by the receiver ID | replace_me_with_url_encoded_receiver_id - will be replaced by the URL encoded receiver ID | replace_me_with_user_name - will be replaced by the receiver user name

Parameters:
  • user_id (str) – Unique identifier for the target user.
  • url_address (str) – URL to be sent. Max 2000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_URL_LENGTH.
  • tracking_data (str, optional) – Allow the account to track messages and user’s replies. Sent tracking_data value will be passed back with user’s reply. Max 4000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_TRACKING_DATA_LENGTH.
  • keyboard (Keyboard, optional) – Keyboard to be sent.
  • min_api_version (int, optional) – Minimal api version.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

On success, the sent message is returned.
Return type:

viber.Message
Raises:

viber.ViberError
send_video(*args, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to send video messages. Message and Keyboard can contain placeholders if list of user_ids used. | replace_me_with_receiver_id - will be replaced by the receiver ID | replace_me_with_url_encoded_receiver_id - will be replaced by the URL encoded receiver ID | replace_me_with_user_name - will be replaced by the receiver user name

Parameters:
  • user_id (str) – Unique identifier for the target user.
  • media (str) – Url of the video(MP4, H264), max size is 50MB. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_VIDEO_SIZE.
  • size (int) – Size of the video in bytes.
  • duration (int, optional) – Video duration in seconds; will be displayed to the receiver, max 180 seconds. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_VIDEO_DURATION.
  • thumbnail (str, optional) – Url of the thumbnail JPEG image, max size is 100KB. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_THUMBNAIL_SIZE.
  • tracking_data (str, optional) – Allow the account to track messages and user’s replies. Sent tracking_data value will be passed back with user’s reply. Max 4000 characters. Also found as viber.constants.MAX_TRACKING_DATA_LENGTH.
  • keyboard (Keyboard, optional) – Keyboard to be sent.
  • min_api_version (int, optional) – Minimal api version.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.
Returns:

On success, the sent message is returned.
Return type:

viber.Message
Raises:

viber.ViberError
set_webhook(url, event_types=None, send_name=True, send_photo=True, timeout=10, **kwargs)¶

Use this method to specify a url and receive incoming events via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an event for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified url, containing a JSON-serialized Event. In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts.

If you’d like to make sure that the Webhook request comes from Viber, we recommend using a secret path in the URL, e.g. https://www.example.com/<token>. Since nobody else knows your bot’s token, you can be pretty sure it’s us.

Note

The certificate argument should be a file from disk open(filename, 'rb').

Parameters:
  • url (str) – HTTPS url to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration.
  • event_types (List[vbier.enums.EventType], optional) – List the types of events you want your bot to receive. See viber.enums.EventType for a complete list of available event types. Specify an empty list to receive all updates regardless of type (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used. Please note that this parameter doesn’t affect events created before the call to the set_webhook, so unwanted events may be received for a short period of time.
  • send_name (bool) – Indicates whether or not the bot should receive the user name.
  • send_photo (bool) – Indicates whether or not the bot should receive the user photo.
  • timeout (int | float, optional) – If this value is specified, use it as the read timeout from the server (instead of the one specified during creation of the connection pool).
  • **kwargs (dict) – Arbitrary keyword arguments.

Note

  1. You will not be able to receive updates using get_events for as long as an outgoing webhook is set up.
  2. You can’t use self-signed certificate
Returns:bool On success, True is returned.
Raises:viber.ViberError
subcategory¶

Subcategory for this bot.

Type:str
